analysis: The documents discuss exceptions to civil service rules, appointments, and modifications to regulations. They cover a range of topics including waiving citizenship requirements, reinstating employees, emergency conditions affecting examinations, appointments without regard to civil service rules, efficiency ratings, allocation of field positions, teller positions at custom houses, interviews with the President, promotions within the District of Columbia police force, reemployment provisions, appointments in custodian service and St. Elizabeths Hospital, amendments to civil service rules, classification of the Department of the Interior and Interstate Commerce Commission, restrictions on instructing for civil service exams, veterans' preference, and appointments related to neutrality and preparedness programs. Sentiment is generally neutral, focusing on the implementation and modification of civil service regulations.
title: Civil Service: Exceptions, Appointments, and Regulatory Modifications
